cab.content: From Viceroy, Foreign Department, blh June 1919. (Received 5th, 10.5 p,m.)Clear the line.610. 6th. Secret. Afghanistan. Our telegram of 2nd June, 7933. In the event of the Amir accepting the proposals for negotiations at Rawalpindi, I have selected Grant, Foreign Secretary, as British representative, with Maffey as Political Adviser. It might strengthen his position, and both impress and gratify Amir if Grant were given a Royal Commission on lines of one issued to McMahon in 1913 for Tibet negotiations. See Foreign Office letter dated 13th August 1913, 31252/13. If you agree, please arrange and despatch as soon as possible. I shall telegraph shortly our proposals for conduct of the negotiations and proposed substance of peace terms and new treaty.
